page.title: 14War Games Club
page.content: {Luscombe woods,}an area of about 44.4 acres, is invaded at weekends and holiday times by teams of men for {combat.}They are dressed in overalls and goggles, armed with air guns which are adapted to fire coloured vegetable fat pellets, and{set to war}tracking one another through the woods. Up to {60 people}play on any one day. The teams hire the equipment from a syndicate of 5 people who own the woods, the guns and the combat uniforms, and who organise the days war game. The people who play (only men seem interested in this kind of activity) {come from all walks of life,}from the towns and cities of the south; Poole, Bournemouth and Southampton.
